fullText: The revival, with a gender-flipped lead and Patti LuPone in glorious voice, finally makes emotional sense of Sondheim's most psychologically complex musical.
dtliExcerpt: The revival, with a gender-flipped lead and Patti LuPone in glorious voice, finally makes emotional sense of Sondheim's most psychologically complex musical.
bwwExcerpt: It's new. And truth be told, I was never less than riveted - if usually in the way Bobby is, eyeballing messy marriages. Nor is the chance to hear the great score live with a 14-piece orchestra to be taken lightly; is there a more exciting opening number than the title song? So I guess I'm sorry-grateful. Sorry for not liking this version of 'Company' better - and grateful to Sondheim for providing the chance to find out.
